properties.areaDesc: Dallam; Potter; Moore; Randall; Hartley; Sherman; Oldham; Cimarron; Deaf Smith
properties.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 24 at 5:26PM CDT expiring March 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
properties.description:
* Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron. In Texas...Dallam...
Sherman...Hartley...Moore...Oldham...Potter...Deaf Smith and
Randall.

* 20 Foot Winds...Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts to
around 35 mph.

* Relative Humidity...As low as 6 to 10 percent.

* Red Flag Threat Index...3 to 6.

* Timing...On Sunday between 11 AM CDT and 8 PM CDT.
properties.instruction:
A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire
weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and
possible red flag warnings.

NWSheadline: FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND THE WESTERN HALF OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE

properties.areaDesc: Hockley; Parmer; Swisher; Hale; Lubbock; Lynn; Cochran; Castro; Yoakum; Terry; Lamb; Bailey
properties.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 24 at 3:04PM CDT expiring March 25 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock TX
properties.description:
* Timing...1 pm Sunday afternoon through 9 pm

* Wind...West to southwest 20 to 30 mph.

* Humidity...12 to 15 percent.

* Fuels...Extremely Dry.

* Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor
burning is discouraged.
properties.instruction:
A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions
are forecast to occur. Monitor later forecasts and possible Red
Flag Warnings.

NWSheadline: FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTH PLAINS...FAR SOUTHERN AND FAR SOUTHWESTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE

properties.areaDesc: Coastal Willacy; Inland Willacy; Inland Cameron; Coastal Cameron; Kenedy
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 24 at 2:39PM CDT expiring March 24 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
properties.description:
A tight pressure gradient and a strong low level jet will will
support strong and gusty winds across the lower Rio Grande Valley
and along the lower Texas coast this afternoon.
* TIMING...10 am to 7 pm.

* WINDS...South 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 40 mph.

* IMPACTS...Lightweight and unsecured objects will be easily
blown around and possibly damaged and small tree damage may
occur. Driving may become difficult, especially high profile
vehicles on east to west roads and highways.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Advisory means that winds of 30 to 39 MPH are expected.
Winds this strong can make driving difficult...especially for
high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING

properties.areaDesc: Guadalupe Mountains; Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County
properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 24 at 2:34PM CDT expiring March 25 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
properties.description:
..HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH
SUNDAY EVENING FOR THE GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS...

.An upper level storm system will approach the region over the
weekend. This will result in increasing winds through the
Guadalupe Mountains late this afternoon and evening. These winds
should diminish somewhat overnight before picking up again Sunday.
* TIMING...Today...From 4 PM this afternoon to midnight MDT
tonight. Sunday...From Sunday morning through Sunday evening.

* WINDS...Southwest to west 35 to 45 mph with gusts to around 60
mph.

* IMPACTS...High winds could make driving difficult for
motorists driving high profile vehicles such as campers, vans,
and tractor trailers.
properties.instruction:
A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected
or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts
of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

A High Wind Watch means there is the potential for a hazardous
high wind event. Sustained winds of at least 40 mph, or gusts of
58 mph or stronger may occur. Continue to monitor the latest
forecasts.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING

properties.areaDesc: Orange, TX; Newton, TX; Beauregard, LA; Calcasieu, LA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:35AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles LA
properties.description:
Calcasieu River Near Glenmora

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Louisiana...Texas..
Atchafalaya River Above Butte La Rose
Atchafalaya River At Morgan City
Sabine River Near Deweyville
The Flood Warning continues for
The Sabine River Near Deweyville.
* until further notice...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At  8:45 AM Saturday the stage was 24.4 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 24.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 24.4 feet by this
afternoon. Additional rises may be possible thereafter.
* Impact...At stages near 24.0 feet...Minor lowland flooding will
occur.
* Impact...At stages near 23.0 feet...The river is at bankfull
stage.

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:08AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
South Sulphur River Near Cooper Affecting Delta and Hopkins
Counties
The Flood Warning continues for
The South Sulphur River Near Cooper.
* At 0815 AM Saturday the stage was 17.40 feet.
* Flood stage is 16 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near  17 feet by
Saturday afternoon. Additional rises may be possible thereafter.
* Forecast...The river will remain near 17 feet for the next few
days.
properties.instruction:
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

Do not drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Stay tuned to NOAA All Hazards Radio for the latest river forecasts.

properties.areaDesc: Otero Mesa; Western El Paso County; Southern Tularosa Basin; Southern Hudspeth Highlands; Southern Gila Highlands/Black Range; Sierra County Lakes; Northern Hudspeth Highlands/Hueco Mountains; Upper Gila River Valley; Northern Dona Ana County; Salt Basin; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Uplands of the Bootheel; Lowlands of the Bootheel; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties; Southern Dona Ana County/Mesilla Valley; Southwest Desert/Mimbres Basin; Southern Gila Foothills/Mimbres Valley; Southwest Desert/Lower Gila River Valley; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Eastern Black Range Foothills; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Eastern/Central El Paso County; Central Tularosa Basin; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
properties.sender: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 24 at 5:55AM MDT expiring March 24 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
An upper level disturbance over the Pacific Northwest will slowly
move slowly in our direction today through Monday, while a
surface low strengthens over southeast Colorado. These two weather
elements will produce windy conditions across the region with
areas of blowing dust and low visibility this afternoon. This
weather pattern will not change much over the next couple of days,
so the threat of strong winds and blowing dust will continue on
Sunday and Monday afternoons.
* TIMING...Winds will increase during the late morning and early
afternoon with maximum speeds occurring from around 3 PM to 6
PM.

* WINDS...West to southwest winds will have sustained speeds
around 25 to 35 mph with gusts from 40 to 50 mph most areas.
However gusts may exceed 55 mph over isolated locations mainly
over the higher mountains and along eastern slopes and
mountain passes.

* IMPACTS...Blowing dust will lower the visibility to less than
a mile over a few areas including along portions of Interstate
10 between El Paso and Las Cruces and also around Deming and
Lordsburg. Driving will be difficult especially for high
profile vehicles.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Advisory means that winds of at least 30 mph are expected.
Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high
profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING
